info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 28 at 2:51AM MDT until March 31 at 4:00AM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO 4 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...While a few light snow showers are possible today and tonight, it now appears the most significant snowfall will not start until Wednesday morning. Total snow accumulations from Wednesday morning through early Friday morning of 6 to 12 inches are expected from passes to valley floors, with locally higher amounts of 12 to 18 inches in the backcountry above about 8,500 feet. * WHERE...The Sawtooths, Stanley Basin, Sun Valley region, Big Lost Highlands, and Copper Basin, including but not limited to Banner Summit, Stanley, Galena Summit, Ketchum, and Sun Valley. * WHEN...From 6 AM Wednesday to 4 AM Friday. * IMPACTS...Periods of slick road conditions and reduced visibility are expected. Snow will also continue to accumulate on already heavily loaded roofs during this period.
info.instruction: If you will be traveling or commuting in the advisory area, slow down, use extra caution, and plan extra time to reach your destination safely. The latest road conditions can be obtained via 511.idaho.gov, the Idaho 511 app, or by calling 5 1 1. Be mindful of additional snowfall accumulating on already loaded roofs across the area.
